page.title: 16Air day at H.M.S. Heron
page.content: {Air Day},usually held in August,is a display of flying at the{R.N.A.S.}that attracts up to 35,000 visitors.Planes come from the U.S.A.and Continental countries to show off their paces. The{Red Arrows}always put on a great show! They are a formation flying team. They will fly wingtip to wingtip or dive from a great height trailing blue and red smoke,pulling out of the dive at the very last moment. Their pilots must have nerves of steel! Older aircraft are on display, some from the{Second World War,}and {Concorde}is rolled out for viewing. Last year a{Falklands War}scene was staged. There are plenty of souvenirs on sale to mark the day,like model planes and badges, mugs,T-shirts and towels. And there is plenty of needed food and drink on sale too!
